gpt-message.content: You are an expert in hardware design with a deep understanding of Verilog RTL codes. Now I want to train a large language model for code comment generation tasks specifically focused on Verilog RTL codes. And I want you to help me process the raw data, transforming it into suitable formats that can serve as inputs and outputs for the model.

Name of the module and its functionality is as follows: 
Module name: rom_async.
Explanation: This module describes a read-only memory (ROM) with asynchronous read operations. It has a parameterizable width and depth, and the capacity to load data from an external file. The ROM memory is an array of registers ("memory") and upon receiving an address input ("addr"), it outputs the data ("data") stored in the corresponding memory location. If a filename is given, it initializes the memory with the contents of the file.

Input and output ports and their explanation is as follows: 
Input ports: addr. Explanation: "addr" is an address signal that is used as an index to access the contents of the memory in the ROM. It is a wire type signal with a bit width equal to the ceiling log base 2 value of the depth, which is calculated with the "$clog2" system function. 

Output ports: data. Explanation: "data" is the output signal that is used to send out the contents of the memory at the position indexed by "addr". It is a wire type signal with the bit width set by the parameter "WIDTH".

Internal signals and their explanation is as follows: 
Internal signals: memory. Explanation: "memory" is an array of registers used as the storage element for the ROM. The size of each register is determined by the 'WIDTH' parameter, and the depth (number of registers) is determined by the 'DEPTH' parameter. It stores the values to be outputted based on the input address 'addr'.
